alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 3:34AM EDT until March 15 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...STORM PULLS AWAY THIS MORNING... .Low pressure will gradually pull away from the region today. A few snow showers remain expected this morning with some minor accumulations possible, but the steadiest and heaviest precipitation is over. However, slippery spots continue to be expected this morning. In addition, gusty winds today will be capable of bringing down branches still weighed down by snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches for a storm total of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Northern Oxford Counties. In New Hampshire, Northern Coos and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact this morning`s commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford
